description.S1: Thomas Kemp, one of the deserters living with Adelaide in the Botanical Lab,
description.S2: is trying to teach himself engineering.
description.S3: He has asked you to bring him any volumes of "A Young Spacer's Guide to Mechanical Engineering" that you find in the Emerald Vale.

blurb.B1: You can obtain this quest by talking to Thomas Kemp near the Workbench at the Botanical Labs location in Emerald Vale.
blurb.B2: Thomas will reveal that he is an incompetent engineer.
blurb.B3: You have a chance to use your Engineering skill if it is high for some XP, and pressing him further will trigger the request for the books.
blurb.B4: You can learn from him of the locations that he knows of:
blurb.B5: One in the Community Center nearby,

description.S1: Thomas said he knows that at least one volume of the set is in the local community center,
description.S2: and that another used to be in the town of Edgewater.
description.S3: He also promised to reward you for any volumes you find,
description.S4: so feel free to return to him with the books as you find them -
description.S5: there's no need to wait until you've found all three.
description.S6: Parvati mentioned her father reading a volume of "A Young Spacer's Guide to Mechanical Engineering" when he was working shifts at the cannery.

blurb.B1: Head to the Edgewater cannery and go to the second floor,
blurb.B2: you can pick up Guide to Mechanical Engineering: Volume 2.
blurb.B3: Head to Emerald Vale Community Center,
blurb.B4: and defeat the Marauder enemies guarding the area.
blurb.B5: You can then go inside and face against a few Marauder enemies that have killed workers and residents and moved in.
blurb.B6: Head right from the entrance and up the stairs to pick up Guide to Mechanical Engineering: Volume 1.
blurb.B7: You'll end up finding Guide to Mechanical Engineering: Volume 3 right next to Higgins on 1F of the Power Plant, picking it up gives 2000xp.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wow. A new face. We're getting popular. I'm Thomas.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Whoa, Ms. Parvati! You're- what- how are- hi. Hi. Hello.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Are you from town? I mean - you don't exactly look like you're from town.

dialog.speaker: Parvati (Female)
dialog.utterance: Are you- um, are things safe out here? How are you keeping?

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Great! Just great! I've been trying to keep stuff running, just like you. Only I'm not so- wait, they didn't kick you out, did they?

dialog.speaker: Parvati (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh gosh, no. I- I'm just along with this fella here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm passing through.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll take that as a compliment.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Sorry - just wasn't sure if you were from town or if you were one of us. Something's been chewing at me, you see.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Fact is, I been - well - lying. To everybody here. Camp thinks I'm a mechanical genius, but I couldn't fix a busted chair.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Never too late to start learning. I could give you a couple pointers.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Maybe you should come clean, then.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why are you telling me this?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're lucky your camp's full of idiots.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't have time for this.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll take all the help I can get. I have set my mind to learning the craft of the engineer, you see. I want to make something of myself.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: You ever heard of The Young Spacer's Guide to Mechanical Engineering? Comes in a set of three. If I had my hands on one of those datapads, I could teach myself the ins-and-outs.

dialog.speaker: Parvati (Female)
dialog.utterance: Those are good. My dad kept a copy with him when he was working in the cannery.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: There's one in the old community center. Should find one back in town, too. Parvati's dad had a copy. He used to take it with him when he worked at the cannery, before he passed.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I know the old community center kept a copy. Should find another one back in town. If you could find me even one of those pads, I'd be greatly obliged.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll let you know if I find anything.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I expect a fair price for my trouble.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You mentioned two pads. What about the third?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I can't promise anything.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Would you? I'd be grateful.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll pay you for every pad you bring me. If, by some miracle, you can bring me the full set, I'll give you something pretty I've been saving for a lucky day.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I wish I knew. I wager the town had the full set, once upon a time. Where the third has gone, I can't say.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I appreciate you hearing me out, at least.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I mean to. I mean to do right by my friends, too. They believed I was an engineer, and so I'll make an engineer out of myself.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, because - because I needed to tell somebody. You ain't one of us and you ain't from Edgewater. So maybe you won't judge me as harshly.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: They're not idiots. They're just trusting. I got away with replacing the odd water filter or battery, but I can't keep this charade up. Time's come for me to learn my craft.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well - what I meant was you're reasonably well-armed and don't look stricken with plague.
